intro: Hieracium mougeotii subsp. intertextum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by ray florets, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Hieracium species.
